title: Identification of suitable extender and cryoprotectant for cryopreservation of Labeo rohita milt
content:
Abstract

The present study was conducted to evaluate the efficacy of different extenders and cryoprotectants for cryopreservation of Labeo rohita milt. Male brood fish (n = 5) reared at fish seed hatchery, Rawal Town Islamabad, Pakistan, were captured from different rearing ponds, and kept in hatchery ponds for acclimatization. After 6 hours, fish were injected with ovaprim at 0.2 ml/kg. After 8 h, milt was collected in a cooled sterilized falcon tube and maintained at 4°C. Spermatozoa were activated and visual motility was observed. Cooled milt was diluted in experimental extenders (Alsever's solution, sugar-based extender and modified Kurokura-2 extender [KE] each with either Me2SO or methanol as cryoprotectant). Diluted milt was filled in 0.5 ml straws and frozen in liquid nitrogen vapours. Cryopreserved milt samples were thawed at 25°C and assessed for fertilization rate and post-thaw sperm quality. Sperm motility, motility duration, viability and total antioxidant capacity were higher in KE with Me2SO and methanol compared with Alsever's solution and sugar-based extender. Sperm DNA integrity showed a similar trend in all treatments. Moreover, sperm fertilization rate was higher (p < 0.05) in KE + methanol compared with KE+ Me2SO. In conclusion, modified KE along with methanol as cryoprotectant proved to be the best diluent for cryopreservation of L. rohita sperm.
